intro: Hieracium peasei, commonly known as the Pease's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It produces yellow to orange disk flowers surrounded by pale green to brown ray florets. Hieracium peasei is often found in open habitats and can thrive in temperate climates.
